data: Filters nullish items from an array
data.signature#Signature: function compact<T extends readonly unknown[]>(xs: T): FilterNullish<T> {}
data.examples#Examples:
compact([])                                    // []
compact([1])                                   // [1]
compact([0, '', null, false, NaN, undefined]) // [0, '', false, NaN, {}]

data: Returns a shallow copy version an array
data.signature#Signature: function copy<T extends any[]>(arr: T): T {}

data: If the given value is not an array already, it wraps the value in an array.
data.signature#Signature: function ensureArray<T>(value: T): EnsureArray<T> {}
data.examples#Examples:
ensureArray(null);           // [null]
ensureArray(undefined);      // [undefined]
ensureArray('string');       // ['string']
ensureArray(['array']);      // ['array']
ensureArray([1, 2, 3]);      // [1, 2, 3]
ensureArray({ foo: 'bar' }); // [{ foo: 'bar' }]

data: Returns a random item from an array
data.signature#Signature: function getRandom<T>(arr: T[]): T {}
data.examples#Examples:
getRandom([])        // undefined
getRandom([1])       // 1
getRandom([1, 2, 3]) // 1 | 2 | 3

data: Return whether an array is empty or not
data.signature#Signature: function isEmpty(x: unknown[]): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
isEmpty([])            // true
isEmpty([1])           // false
isEmpty([undefined])   // false
isEmpty([null])        // false
isEmpty([,])           // false
isEmpty([, null])      // false
isEmpty([, undefined]) // false

data: Check whether an index is the last index of an array.
data.signature#Signature: function isLastIndex(arr: unknown[], index: number): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
isLastIndex([1], 0)           // true
isLastIndex([1, 2], 1)        // true
isLastIndex([[], [], []], 2)  // true
isLastIndex([undefined], 0)   // true
isLastIndex([null], 0)        // true
isLastIndex([,], 0)           // true
isLastIndex([,,], 1)          // true
isLastIndex([, null], 1)      // true
isLastIndex([, undefined], 1) // true
isLastIndex([], 0)            // false
isLastIndex([], -1)           // false
isLastIndex([[], [], []], 0)  // false

data: Checks whether the given value is null, undefined or empty array.
data.signature#Signature: function isNullOrEmptyArray<T extends any[]>(arr: Nullable<T | []>): arr is Nullable<[]> {}
data.examples#Examples:
isNullOrEmptyArray(null)        // true
isNullOrEmptyArray(undefined)   // true
isNullOrEmptyArray([])          // true
isNullOrEmptyArray([0])         // false
isNullOrEmptyArray([,])         // false
isNullOrEmptyArray([null])      // false
isNullOrEmptyArray([undefined]) // false

data: join path parts with "/" and without trailing and leading slashes.
data.signature#Signature: joinPath(array)
data.examples#Examples:
joinPath(['a', 'b'])                               // 'a/b'
joinPath(['a', '/b'])                              // 'a/b'
joinPath(['a', 'b/'])                              // 'a/b'
joinPath(['a', '/b/'])                             // 'a/b'
joinPath(['a/', 'b'])                              // 'a/b'
joinPath(['a/', '/b'])                             // 'a/b'
joinPath(['a/', 'b/'])                             // 'a/b'
joinPath(['a/', '/b/'])                            // 'a/b'
joinPath(['/a', 'b'])                              // 'a/b'
joinPath(['/a', '/b'])                             // 'a/b'
joinPath(['/a', 'b/'])                             // 'a/b'
joinPath(['/a', '/b/'])                            // 'a/b'
joinPath(['https://a.com', 'b'])                   // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPath(['https://a.com', '/b'])                  // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPath(['https://a.com', 'b/'])                  // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPath(['https://a.com/', '/b/'])                // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPath(['https://a.com/', '?b=a'])               // 'https://a.com/?b=a'
joinPath(['https://a.com/', '/b/', '?query'])      // 'https://a.com/b/?query',
joinPath(['https://a.com/', '?query', '&a=query']) // 'https://a.com/?query/&a=query',

data: Create an array of specific length with a step and an offset.
data.signature#Signature: function range(length: number, offset: number = 0, step: number = 1): number[];

data: Return a shuffled version of an array
data.signature#Signature: function shuffle<T extends any[]>(arr: T): T {}
data.examples#Examples:
shuffle([])        // []
shuffle([1])       // [1]
shuffle([1, 2, 3]) // Who knows?

data:
Returns array representation of a value.
when the value is already an array it return the value.
when the value is undefined or null it returns [].
when the value is iterable it returns array representation of the value.
otherwise it wraps the value in an array.
data.examples#Examples:
toArray(null)      // []
toArray(undefined) // []
toArray('str')     // ['s', 't', 'r']
toArray([1])       // [1]
toArray(2)         // [2]

data: Asserts a value is not null or undefined
data.signature#Signature: function assertNotNull<T>(value: Nullable<T>, error: string = 'Value is required'): asserts value is NonNullable<T> {}
data.examples#Examples:
assertNotNull(null, 'WTF')      // Throw 'WTF'
assertNotNull(undefined, 'WTF') // Throw 'WTF'
assertNotNull(true)             // noop

data: Throws an error when the condition is not true.
data.signature#Signature: function assert(condition: boolean, msg: string = 'Assertion failed'): void {}
data.examples#Examples:
assert(false, 'WTF') // Throw 'WTF'
assert(true, 'WTF')  // noop

data: Expression form of throw
data.signature#Signature: function throwErr(err: unknown): never {}
data.examples#Examples:
throwErr('oops')              // throw 'oops'
throwErr(Error('oops'))       // throw Error('oops')
throwErr(CustomError('oops')) // throw CustomError('oops')

data: a HOC function that can call all given functions.
data.signature#Signature: function callAll<T>(...fns: Nullable<Function>[]) {}
data.examples#Examples:
callAll(foo, bar, baz)(1);                         // void(foo(1), bar(1), baz(1))
callAll(bar, null, undefined, baz)(); // void (bar(), baz());

data:
The debounce function is commonly used to ensure that time-consuming tasks do
not fire too often. It waits for a set interval after the last invocation before
executing the callback function.If immediate is set to true, the original function will be called
immediately. However, the function won't be called again unless the debounced
function stops being invoked for the specified duration.
No operation ¬Ø\(„ÉÑ)/¬Ø.
data.signature#Signature: function noop(): void {}
data.examples#Examples: noop() // undefined

data: Returns the complement of its argument.
data.signature#Signature: function not(b: any): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
not(true)  // false
not(false) // true
not(0)     // true
not(1)     // false

data: Returns a promise that resolves after a certain milliseconds.
data.signature#Signature: function sleep(ms: number): Promise<void> {}
data.examples#Examples:
sleep(1000).then(() => console.log("Hi")) // Logs hi after 1 second
await sleep(1000); console.log("Hi")      // Logs hi after 1 second

data:
Returns a new function that triggers the given callback only if a specified
interval of time has elapsed since its previous invocation.

data.node#Node:
npm
npm install --save-dev @fullstacksjs/toolbox
pnpm
pnpm add --save-dev @fullstacksjs/toolbox
yarn
yarn add --dev @fullstacksjs/toolbox
data.browser-esm#Browser ESM:
ES Module
<script type="module">
import * as toolbox from 'https://www.unpkg.com/@fullstacksjs/toolbox@<VERSION>/lib/esm/index.js';
</script>
Script
<script src='https://www.unpkg.com/@fullstacksjs/toolbox/iife/index.js'></script>
<script>
console.log(window.Toolbox)
</script>

data: Guard functions
Checks whether the given value is boolean or not
data.signature#Signature: function isBoolean(x: unknown): x is boolean {};
data.examples#Examples:
isBoolean(true)      // true
isBoolean(false)     // true
isBoolean('')        // false
isBoolean(undefined) // false
isBoolean(null)      // false
isBoolean(1)         // false
isBoolean(['1'])     // false

data: Check whether the given value is a functions or not
data.signature#Signature: function isFunction(x: unknown): x is Function {}
data.examples#Examples:
isFunction(() => 1)   // true
isFunction(undefined) // false
isFunction(true)      // false
isFunction('string')  // false

data: Check whether the given value is iteratable or not
data.signature#Signature: function isIterable<T>(x: unknown): x is Iterable<T> {}
data.examples#Examples:
isIterable([])        // true
isIterable(new Map()) // true
isIterable('some')    // true
isIterable({})        // false
isIterable(undefined) // false

data: Check whether the given value is not nullable (undefined or null)
data.signature#Signature: function isNotNull<T>(x: T): x is NonNullable<T> {}
data.examples#Examples:
isNotNull(undefined) // false
isNotNull(null)      // false
isNotNull('null')    // true
isNotNull(0)         // true
isNotNull([])        // true
isNotNull({})        // true
isNotNull(false)     // true

data: Check whether the given value is nullable (undefined or null)
data.signature#Signature: function isNull(x: unknown): x is Nullish {};
data.examples#Examples:
isNull(undefined) // true
isNull(null)      // true
isNull('null')    // false
isNull(0)         // false
isNull([])        // false
isNull({})        // false
isNull(false)     // false

data: Check whether the given value is an object
data.signature#Signature: function isObject(x: unknown): x is Record<number | string | symbol, any> {}
data.examples#Examples:
* isObject('')            // false
* isObject('hello world') // false
* isObject(null)          // false
* isObject(true)          // false
* isObject(undefined)     // false
* isObject(NaN)           // false
* isObject(0)             // false
* isObject(isObject)      // false
* isObject(false)         // false
* isObject([])            // false
* isObject([2])           // false
* isObject({})            // true
* isObject({ a: 2 })      // true
* isObject({ 2: 'a' })    // true

data: Check whether the given value is string or not
data.signature#Signature: function isString(x: unknown): x is string {}
data.examples#Examples:
isString('')        // true
isString(undefined) // false
isString(null)      // false
isString(1)         // false
isString(['1'])     // false

data: Check whether the given value is truthy
data.signature#Signature: function isTruthy<T>(x: T): x is Truthy<T> {};
data.examples#Examples:
isTruthy(undefined) // false
isTruthy(NaN)    // false
isTruthy(false)  // false
isTruthy(0)      // false
isTruthy(null)   // false
isTruthy('null') // true
isTruthy(1)      // true
isTruthy([])     // true
isTruthy({})     // true

data:
Welcome to Toolbox! A zero-dependency üì¶, tree-shakableüå≤ collection of
missing JavaScript utilities.
data.why-toolbox#Why Toolbox?:
üì¶Ô∏è Zero-dependencies: You only need one external library to replace all
others.
üå≤ Efficient tree-shaking: Adding just one function will only increase
your bundle by 3 lines.
üèóÔ∏è Modern: works with ESM, Deno, NodeJS and browser
üß™ Fully tested: All functions are thoroughly tested with unit tests.
ü•Ö Practical focus: Only functions with practical applications are
included in the library collection.
data.motivation#Motivation:
The @fullstacksjs/toolbox aims to provide a simple and practical solution to
the lack of essential utilities in JavaScript.It eliminates the need for code duplication or excessive third-party
dependencies, simplifying the development process. Say goodbye üëã to dependency
hell üî• and enjoy simplicity.

data: Check whether NodeJS Env is development.
data.signature#Signature: function getNodeEnv(fallback?: string): string {}

data: Check whether NodeJS Env is development.
data.signature#Signature: function isDev(): boolean {}

data: Check whether NodeJS Env is production.
data.signature#Signature: function isProd(): boolean {}

data: Safely pass a nullable value to composition of functions
data.signature#Signature: function bind<T, U>(x: Nullable<T>, ...fns: Function[]): U {}
data.examples#Examples:
bind(null,f)           // null
bind(1, f)             // f(1)
bind(2, f, g, h)       // h(g(f(2)))
bind(null, f, g, h, j) // null

data: Gets some nullable arrays and returns concatenation of existing ones.
data.signature#Signature: function concatArrays<T extends any[]>(...mas: T): T[] {}
data.examples#Examples:
concatArrays(undefined)                       // []
concatArrays(null, undefined)                 // []
concatArrays([])                              // []
concatArrays(undefined, [1, 2], null)         // [1, 2]
concatArrays(undefined, [1, 2], null, [3, 4]) // [1, 2, 3, 4]
concatArrays([1, 2], ['3', '4'])              // [1, 2, '3', '4']
concatArrays([1, 2])                          // [1, 2]

data: Clamps a number between two values
data.signature#Signature: function clamp(value: number, min: number, max: number): number {}

data: Divides two numbers returns fallback if result is not a finite number
data.signature#Signature: function divide(dividend: number, divisor: number, fallback: number = NaN): number {}
data.examples#Examples:
divide(4, 2)     // 2
divide(4, 0, 42) // 42
divide(4, 0)     // NaN

data: Returns the value if the given value is finite; otherwise, it returns the fallback value.
data.signature#Signature: function fallbackNumber<T extends number = number>(value: Nullable<T>, fallbackValue: T): NonNullable<T> {}
data.examples#Examples:
fallbackNumber(0, 1)         // 0
fallbackNumber(-1, 1)        // -1
fallbackNumber(1, -1)        // 1
fallbackNumber(-0, 1)        // -0
fallbackNumber(NaN, 1)       // 1
fallbackNumber(Infinity, 1)  // 1
fallbackNumber(-Infinity, 1) // 1

data: Checks if num is between min and max (including borders).
data.signature#Signature: function isInRange(num: number, min: number, max: number): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
isInRange(51, 0, 50)   // false
isInRange(-1, 0, 100)  // true
isInRange(100, 0, 100) // true
isInRange(0, 0, 100)   // true
isInRange(50, 0, 100)  // true

data: Returns percentage value of a number from a maximum number
data.signature#Signature: function percent(value: number, max: number): number {}
data.examples#Examples:
percent(0, 10)   // 0
percent(1, 10)   // 10
percent(-1, 10)  // 0
percent(20, 10)  // 100
percent(NaN, 10) // 0
percent(10, NaN) // 0
percent(1, 3)    // 33.33333333333333

data: Generate a random integer number between two values. (borders are included)
data.signature#Signature: function randomInt(min: number = 0, max: number = Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER): number {}
data.examples#Examples:
randomInt()      // Random between 0,  MAX_SAFE_INTEGER
randomInt(10)    // Random between 10, MAX_SAFE_INTEGER
randomInt(0, 1)  // 0 | 1

data: Parses the string to decimal and returns fallback when the value is not finite
data.import#Import: function toDecimal(s: string, fallback: number = NaN): number {}
data.signature#Signature: function toDecimal(min: number = 0, max: number = Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER): number {}
data.examples#Examples:
toDecimal('S')            // NaN
toDecimal('100')          // 100
toDecimal('1.42')         // 1
toDecimal('S', 10)        // 10
toDecimal('S', undefined) // NaN

data: Remove key from an object when predicate is true
data.signature#Signature: function pruneKeyWhen(min: number = 0, max: number = Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER): number {}

data: Remove property from an object when predicate is true
data.signature#Signature: function pruneValueWhen(min: number = 0, max: number = Number.MAX_SAFE_INTEGER): number {}

data:
Escapes regex charsIf you need to use any of the special characters literally (actually searching
for a "", for instance), you must escape it by putting a backslash in front of
it. For instance, to search for "a" followed by "" followed by "b", you'd use
/a*b/ ‚Äî the backslash "escapes" the "*", making it literal instead of special.
Read more on
MDN
data.signature#Signature: function escapeRegex(s: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
new RegExp(escapeRegex('^[](){}$')).test('^[](){}$') // true
new RegExp(escapeRegex('^a$')).test('a')             // false

data: Check if a string passes a specific regex
data.signature#Signature: function testRegex(regex: RegExp, str: string): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
const regexA = /a/g
testRegex(regexA, 'a') // true
regexA.lastIndex       // 0

const regexB = /b/g
testRegex(regexB, 'a') // false
regexB.lastIndex       // 0

data: Compare two path without trailing and leading slashes
data.examples#Examples:
comparePaths('b', 'a')                // 1
comparePaths('a', 'b')                // -1
comparePaths('path', 'PAth')          // 0
comparePaths('reserve', 'r√©serv√©')    // 0
comparePaths('/path1/', '/path1/')    // 0
comparePaths('reserve', 'reserve//')  // 0
comparePaths('//reserve', 'reserve')  // 0
comparePaths('reserve//', 'reserve/') // 0
comparePaths('/reserve', '//reserve') // 0

data: Converts crlf to lf
data.signature#Signature: function crlfToLf(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
crlfToLf('hello world
')   // 'hello world
'
crlfToLf('hello world

') // 'hello world

'
crlfToLf('hello world
')     // 'hello world
'
crlfToLf('hello world')       // 'hello world'
crlfToLf('')                  // ''
crlfToLf(' ')                 // ' '

data: Returns the provided fallback value if the given value is null, undefined, or an empty string; otherwise, it returns the original value.
data.signature#Signature: function fallbackString<T extends string = string>(value: Nullable<T>, fallbackStringValue: T): NonNullable<T> {}
data.examples#Examples:
fallbackString('', 'd')        // 'd'
fallbackString(' ', 'd')       // ' '
fallbackString('x', 'd')       // 'x'
fallbackString(null, 'd')      // 'd'
fallbackString(undefined, 'd') // 'd'

data: Returns initial characters of spaces separated words
data.signature#Signature: function getInitials(name: string, fallback: string = '?'): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
getInitials('')                  // '?'
getInitials(' ', 'FB')           // 'FB'
getInitials('frontend')          // 'F'
getInitials('frontend monsters') // 'FM'
getInitials('2')                 // '2'
getInitials('1 2 3 4')           // '1234'
getInitials('x @# % * ))__() 1') // 'X@%*)1'
getInitials('frontend monster rides a dinosaur in office') // 'FMRADIO'

data: Returns a boolean indicating whether the string is lower case.
data.signature#Signature: function isLowerCase(str: string): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
isLowerCase('')           // false
isLowerCase('test')       // true
isLowerCase('TEST')       // false
isLowerCase('Test')       // false
isLowerCase('123')        // false
isLowerCase('snake_case') // true

data: Checks whether the given value is null, undefined or empty string.
data.signature#Signature: function isNullOrEmptyString(str: Nullable<string>): str is Nullable<''> {}
data.examples#Examples:
isNullOrEmptyString(null)      // true
isNullOrEmptyString(undefined) // true
isNullOrEmptyString('')        // true
isNullOrEmptyString('f')       // false

data: Joins path parts with / and remove trailing and leading slashes
data.signature#Signature: function joinPaths(...paths: string[]): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
joinPaths('a', 'b')                               // 'a/b'
joinPaths('a', '/b')                              // 'a/b'
joinPaths('a', 'b/')                              // 'a/b'
joinPaths('a', '/b/')                             // 'a/b'
joinPaths('a/', 'b')                              // 'a/b'
joinPaths('a/', '/b')                             // 'a/b'
joinPaths('a/', 'b/')                             // 'a/b'
joinPaths('a/', '/b/')                            // 'a/b'
joinPaths('/a', 'b')                              // 'a/b'
joinPaths('/a', '/b')                             // 'a/b'
joinPaths('/a', 'b/')                             // 'a/b'
joinPaths('/a', '/b/')                            // 'a/b'
joinPaths('https://a.com', 'b')                   // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPaths('https://a.com', '/b')                  // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPaths('https://a.com', 'b/')                  // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPaths('https://a.com/', '/b/')                // 'https://a.com/b'
joinPaths('https://a.com/', '?b=a')               // 'https://a.com/?b=a'
joinPaths('https://a.com/', '/b/', '?query')      // 'https://a.com/b/?query'
joinPaths('https://a.com/', '?query', '&a=query') // 'https://a.com/?query/&a=query'

data: Removes leading slashes from a string
data.signature#Signature: function removeLeadingSlashes(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
removeLeadingSlashes('')           // ''
removeLeadingSlashes('/')          // ''
removeLeadingSlashes('string')     // 'string'
removeLeadingSlashes('/string')    // 'string'
removeLeadingSlashes('//string')   // 'string'
removeLeadingSlashes('//string/')  // 'string/'
removeLeadingSlashes('//string/a') // 'string/a'

data: Removes trailing slashes from a string
data.signature#Signature: function removeTrailingSlashes(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
removeTrailingSlashes('')           // ''
removeTrailingSlashes('/')          // ''
removeTrailingSlashes('string')     // 'string'
removeTrailingSlashes('/string')    // 'string'
removeTrailingSlashes('//string')   // 'string'
removeTrailingSlashes('//string/')  // 'string/'
removeTrailingSlashes('//string/a') // 'string/a'

data: Converts any casing to camelCase
data.signature#Signature: function camelCaseTransform(input: string, index: number) {}
data.examples#Examples:
toCamelCase('')             // ''
toCamelCase(' ')            // ''
toCamelCase('foo')          // 'foo'
toCamelCase('foo bar')      // 'fooBar'
toCamelCase('foo-bar')      // 'fooBar'
toCamelCase('fooBar')       // 'fooBar'
toCamelCase('foo_bar')      // 'fooBar'
toCamelCase('foo bar code') // 'fooBarCode'
toCamelCase('foo-bar-code') // 'fooBarCode'
toCamelCase('fooBarCode')   // 'fooBarCode'
toCamelCase('foo_bar_code') // 'fooBarCode'
toCamelCase('FOO_BAR_CODE') // 'fooBarCode'
toCamelCase('ThisIs-fullstacksjs radio__and--I-loveCoding') // 'thisIsFullstacksjsRadioAndILoveCoding'

data:
Converts the starting letter of every word into an upper case and will leave the
remaining letters as lower case ones.
data.signature#Signature: function toCapitalCase(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
toCapitalCase(''); // ''
toCapitalCase(' '); // ''
toCapitalCase('foo'); // 'Foo'
toCapitalCase('foo bar'); // 'Foo Bar'
toCapitalCase('foo-bar'); // 'Foo Bar'
toCapitalCase('fooBar'); // 'Foo Bar'
toCapitalCase('foo_bar'); // 'Foo Bar'
toCapitalCase('foo bar code'); // 'Foo Bar Code'
toCapitalCase('foo-bar-code'); // 'Foo Bar Code'
toCapitalCase('fooBarCode'); // 'Foo Bar Code'
toCapitalCase('foo_bar_code'); // 'Foo Bar Code'
toCapitalCase('FOO_BAR_CODE'); // 'Foo Bar Code'
toCapitalCase('ThisIs-fullstacksjs radio__and--I-loveCoding'); // This Is Fullstacksjs Radio And I Love Coding

data: Converts any casing to kebab-case
data.signature#Signature: function toKebabCase(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
toKebabCase('')             // ''
toKebabCase(' ')            // ''
toKebabCase('foo')          // 'foo'
toKebabCase('foo bar')      // 'foo-bar'
toKebabCase('foo-bar')      // 'foo-bar'
toKebabCase('fooBar')       // 'foo-bar'
toKebabCase('foo_bar')      // 'foo-bar'
toKebabCase('foo bar code') // 'foo-bar-code'
toKebabCase('foo-bar-code') // 'foo-bar-code'
toKebabCase('fooBarCode')   // 'foo-bar-code'
toKebabCase('foo_bar_code') // 'foo-bar-code'
toKebabCase('FOO_BAR_CODE') // 'foo-bar-code'
toKebabCase('ThisIs-fullstacksjs radio__and--I-loveCoding') // 'this-is-fullstacksjs-radio-and-i-love-coding',

data: Converts any casing to PascalCase
data.signature#Signature: function toPascalCase(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
toPascalCase('')              '// '
toPascalCase(' ')             '// '
toPascalCase('foo')            // 'Foo'
toPascalCase('foo bar')        // 'FooBar'
toPascalCase('foo-bar')        // 'FooBar'
toPascalCase('fooBar')         // 'FooBar'
toPascalCase('foo_bar')        // 'FooBar'
toPascalCase('foo bar code')   // 'FooBarCode'
toPascalCase('foo-bar-code')   // 'FooBarCode'
toPascalCase('fooBarCode')     // 'FooBarCode'
toPascalCase('foo_bar_code')   // 'FooBarCode'
toPascalCase('FOO_BAR_CODE')   // 'FooBarCode'
toPascalCase('foo_ -BaRC ode') // 'FooBaRcOde'
toPascalCase('ThisIs-fullstacksjs radio__and--I-loveCoding') // 'ThisIsFullstacksjsRadioAndILoveCoding'

data: Converts any casing to snake_case
data.signature#Signature: function toSnakeCase(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
toSnakeCase('')             // ''
toSnakeCase(' ')            // ''
toSnakeCase('foo')          // 'foo'
toSnakeCase('foo bar')      // 'foo_bar'
toSnakeCase('foo-bar')      // 'foo_bar'
toSnakeCase('fooBar')       // 'foo_bar'
toSnakeCase('foo_bar')      // 'foo_bar'
toSnakeCase('foo bar code') // 'foo_bar_code'
toSnakeCase('foo-bar-code') // 'foo_bar_code'
toSnakeCase('fooBarCode')   // 'foo_bar_code'
toSnakeCase('foo_bar_code') // 'foo_bar_code'
toSnakeCase('FOO_BAR_CODE') // 'foo_bar_code'
toSnakeCase('ThisIs-fullstacksjs radio__and--I-loveCoding') // 'this_is_fullstacksjs_radio_and_i_love_coding'

data: Separates words by space and makes them lowercase.
data.signature#Signature: function toSpaceCase(str: string): string {}
data.examples#Examples:
toSpaceCase(''); // ''
toSpaceCase(' '); // ''
toSpaceCase('foo'); // 'foo'
toSpaceCase('foo bar'); // 'foo bar'
toSpaceCase('foo-bar'); // 'foo bar'
toSpaceCase('fooBar'); // 'foo bar'
toSpaceCase('foo_bar'); // 'foo bar'
toSpaceCase('foo bar code'); // 'foo bar code'
toSpaceCase('foo-bar-code'); // 'foo bar code'
toSpaceCase('fooBarCode'); // 'foo bar code'
toSpaceCase('foo_bar_code'); // 'foo bar code'
toSpaceCase('FOO_BAR_CODE'); // 'foo bar code'
toSpaceCase('FOO BAR CODE'); // 'foo bar code'
toSpaceCase('foo_ -BaRC ode'); // 'foo ba rc ode'
toSpaceCase('ThisIs-fullstacksjs radio__and--I-loveCoding'); // 'this is fullstacksjs radio and i love coding'

data: type name = Nullable<string> // null | string
Returns true when runtime is a browser.
data.signature#Signature: function isBrowser(): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
if (isBrowser()) alert('I will run in the client only');
if (!isBrowser()) console.log('This runs in server environment');

data: Returns true when runtime is Bun
data.signature#Signature: function isBun(): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
if (isBun()) console.log(Bun.version);
if (!isBun()) console.log('Node, Deno, or browser?');

data: Returns true when runtime is Deno.
data.signature#Signature: function isDeno(): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
if (isDeno()) Deno.cwd();
if (!isDeno()) console.log('NodeJS, bun, or browser?');

data: Returns true when runtime is NodeJS.
data.signature#Signature: function isNodeJS(): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
if (isNodeJS()) global.process.env;
if (!isNodeJS()) console.log('Deno, bun, or browser?');

data: Returns true when runtime is a server-side
data.signature#Signature: function isServer(): boolean {}
data.examples#Examples:
if (isServer()) console.log('This runs in server environment');
if (!isServer()) alert('I will run in the client only');
